poem:
Title: Echoes On New Lodge

In the cobbled heart of west Belfast,
where history hangs heavy as the clouds,
those Painful Pasts winter within walls.
Amidst domestic sparrows, nostalgia nestles,
a poignant pulse in concrete veins,
the Troubles — an echo of agonizing refrain.
Coexistence, a question unanswered,
haunted by specters of shattered yesteryears,
in the run-down estate, the Flats stand,
Part saga, part dirge, all human stain.
